Key Match Events: Ryan Mendes' late penalty gave Cape Verde a dramatic 1-0 win over Mauritania.
Yassin El Welly's mistake led to a penalty for Cape Verde.
Gilson Benchimol was brought down by Babacar Niasse, resulting in the penalty.
Cape Verde survived ten minutes of stoppage-time to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde went into the match as favourites, having topped Group B ahead of Egypt and Ghana.
Mauritania edged through to the knockout stages after stunning Algeria in their final group-stage game, marking their first ever win at the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Ryan Mendes' penalty secured Cape Verde's place in the quarter-finals of the Africa Cup of Nations.
Mauritania's impressive performance ended in a cruel defeat due to a single mistake.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mauritania competed in their first AFCON knockout game.
Cape Verde will face either Morocco or South Africa in the quarter-finals.
